channel.title: Home on Lei Yan's Cool Website
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Lei Yan's Cool Website

item.title: A Network analysis of Game of Thrones (Part 1)
item.description: Which one is the most important character in Game of Thrones? How the importance of characters evolves over the books? How to define the importance of characters? Is there a strong correlation between different measures of importance? After you read this post, you can easily answer the above questions! This actually is a DataCamp Project. But I modified some code to draw three more beautiful pictures and added some comments.

item.title: Machine Learning Resources
item.description: I will continue adding new good resources to this post. But don’t get lost in them. Choose one and keep learning. After you finished one course, then choose another one. Hope this can be helpful to you! Roadmap of DL and ML For a newecomer to deep learning and machine learning area, facing some much courses and resources, the first question is how to choose right books and courses to begin this trip.

item.title: Books I read in 2018
item.description: 这里我列一下我今年读过的和正在读书，希望你能找到对你口味的~ 《白鹿原》 陈老说他在这本书中很少用用到肖像描写，更多的是通过心理描写来让大家记住

item.title: MY 2018
item.description: 2018就要过去了，我想回顾一下它。 一月份： 考完试后，我并没有回家，而是留在了学校准备和胡总，嘉源参加美赛。当时大家一个比一个有信心，我呢是

item.title: R4DS_solutions
item.description: 5.6.7 Exercises library(tidyverse) library(nycflights13) Creat not_cancelled for problems use. not_cancelled <- flights %>% filter(!is.na(dep_delay), !is.na(arr_delay)) 1. I don’t like this question, so I choose to ignore it. 2. Come up with another approach that will give you the same output as not_cancelled %>% count(dest) and not_cancelled %>% count(tailnum, wt = distance) (without using count()). not_cancelled %>% group_by(dest) %>% summarise(n = n()) ## # A tibble: 104 x 2 ## dest n ## <chr> <int> ## 1 ABQ 254 ## 2 ACK 264 ## 3 ALB 418 ## 4 ANC 8 ## 5 ATL 16837 ## 6 AUS 2411 ## 7 AVL 261 ## 8 BDL 412 ## 9 BGR 358 ## 10 BHM 269 ## # .

item.title: About This Website
item.description: This website is created by blogdown and hugo. I used the XMIN template designed by Yihui Xie. Specificly, I followed the online book: blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown, but in practice, I encountered many problems when I read it. So I will write a post about how I solve those problems and finally set up this website.
